questionText: It is estimated that from three to five or even nine percent of children have ADD/ADHD.
author: A2IU5TX5S0FA1C

questionText: Twenty percent of children diagnosed with ADD/ADHD may outgrow it.
author: A2IU5TX5S0FA1C

questionText: Onset of ADHD does not occur in adulthood except through trauma.
author: AJQGWGESKQT4Y

questionText: It is estimated that from three to five or even nine percent of children have the disorder.
author: AJQGWGESKQT4Y

questionText: An increase in the number of diagnoses of ADHD is attributed to include either hyperactivity or impulsive behavior.
author: AJQGWGESKQT4Y

questionText: Critics say that doctors are too quick to diagnose ADHD and over-prescribe drugs for children.
author: AJQGWGESKQT4Y

questionText: Ritalin has side effects including sleeplessness and loss of appetite.
author: AJQGWGESKQT4Y

questionText: No drug has been yet found to treat the disorder.
author: AJQGWGESKQT4Y

questionText: ADD/ADHD is diagnosed through behavioral patterns.
author: AJQGWGESKQT4Y

questionText: Until recently there have been no biological or medical tests to confirm diagnosis.
author: AJQGWGESKQT4Y

questionText: Diagnosis was by descriptions of behavior by teachers and medical professionals.
author: AJQGWGESKQT4Y

questionText: Attention Deficit Disorder, ADHD, has become increasingly common in American children.
author: A2IU5TX5S0FA1C

questionText: Some 2.5 million American children have been diagnosed with ADHD.
author: A2IU5TX5S0FA1C

questionText: ADHD, a chemical disorder in the brain, can cause impulsivity, inability to concentrate, and difficulty learning.
author: A2IU5TX5S0FA1C

questionText: There has been much controversy around diagnosis and treatment of ADHD.
author: A2IU5TX5S0FA1C

questionText: In 2000, for the first time the American Academy of Pediatrics set specific guidelines for diagnosis of ADHD.
author: A2IU5TX5S0FA1C

questionText: The most common treatments for ADHD are the stimulant drugs, Ritalin or Adderall.
author: A2IU5TX5S0FA1C

questionText: ADHD, attention-deficit-hyperactivity disorder, is a neurological and genetic disorder.
author: AJQGWGESKQT4Y

questionText: ADHD is  characterized by impulsivity, inattentiveness, and lack of inhibition and self-control.
author: AJQGWGESKQT4Y

questionText: The American Psychiatric Association first described it in 1980.
author: AJQGWGESKQT4Y

questionText: Those diagnosed appear to have a deficiency in certain brain receptors involved in processing the neurotransmitter dopamine.
author: AJQGWGESKQT4Y

questionText: It is difficult to diagnose ADHD because there are other kinds of problems, such as anxiety and depression.
author: AJQGWGESKQT4Y

questionText: Medication so far appears to be more effective than behavior modification therapy when treating ADHD alone.
author: AJQGWGESKQT4Y

questionText: Attention-deficit-hyperactivity disorder is characterized by impulsivity, inattentiveness, and lack of self-control.
author: A49WTQG4MBT9Z

questionText: ADHD was first described in 1980 by the American Psychiatric Association.
author: A49WTQG4MBT9Z

questionText: People diagnosed are lacking in certain brain receptors that process the neurotransmitter dopamine.
author: A49WTQG4MBT9Z

questionText: ADHD may be a chronic condition that can last a lifetime.
author: A49WTQG4MBT9Z

questionText: Ritalin is the most effective way to treat ADHD.
author: A49WTQG4MBT9Z

questionText: The use of medicine is more effective than behavior modification therapy.
author: A49WTQG4MBT9Z

questionText: Ritalin can have negative side effects for children.
author: A49WTQG4MBT9Z

questionText: ADHD is a common psychiatric illness.
author: A2CCK1JKX48R0H

questionText: Symptoms of ADHD include impulsiveness, inability to concentrate, difficulty in learning and restlessness.
author: A2CCK1JKX48R0H

questionText: There are 4 types of ADHD.
author: A2CCK1JKX48R0H

questionText: There are two main types of treatment for ADHD: behavior modification therapy and drugs.
author: A2CCK1JKX48R0H

questionText: A big controversy surrounding ADHD drugs is the long range effects of those drugs.
author: A2CCK1JKX48R0H

questionText: People with Type A ADHD experience inattentiveness and distractability.
author: A2CCK1JKX48R0H

questionText: ADHD, a common psychiatric illnes, affects 3-9% of all children.
author: AJQGWGESKQT4Y

questionText: ADHD is difficult to diagnose.
author: AJQGWGESKQT4Y

questionText: Outward symptoms generally include impulsiveness, inability to concentrate, difficulty in learning, and restlessness.
author: AJQGWGESKQT4Y

questionText: Type A is characterized by inattentiveness and distractability.
author: AJQGWGESKQT4Y

questionText: Type B by hyperactivity and impulsive behavior.
author: AJQGWGESKQT4Y

questionText: Type C a combination of the two.
author: AJQGWGESKQT4Y

questionText: Adderall, a mixture of two kinds of amphetamines, is effective for treating ADHD.
author: AJQGWGESKQT4Y

questionText: Claims that dietary supplements help are questionable.
author: AJQGWGESKQT4Y
